title-group.article-title: RE: Improper Citation of Previously Published Work in Ghosh et al

body.p: Thank you for your letter. First off, let me congratulate you on your excellent 2009 paper1 describing an ex vivo approach to studying subglottic stenosis. Based on your important work, our lab developed our own independent model for subglottic stenosis using mechanical injury and chemical injury. This was originally presented in a paper at COSM in 2010. It was also cited in our publication “Pulse Steroid Therapy Inhibits Murine Subglottic Granulation,” citation 13. Since then, we have further developed our model and a number of papers have originated. In response to your comment: specifically, the 2013 paper,2 where it is stated that the current study is an extension of previous work—we are in fact describing the previous work from our lab including the previous papers and presentations that have resulted. However, as this model originally stemmed from your important 2009 manuscript, I apologize for the oversight in attribution and will rectify future papers such that your paper is appropriately cited in the background. We look forward to reading more of your work on this important topic and once again appreciate your input.
